etymologies: Urdu benāmī, from Persian, literally ‘the state of being without a name’

definitions: (in South Asia) denoting a purchase of property that is conducted in such a way as to conceal the identity of the true buyer

examples.text: due to the crackdown on benami transactions, dubious players are likely to be pushed out of the market

shortDefinitions: transacted so as to conceal idenitty of true buyer
